column1: Lianozovo District (Russian: райо́н Лиано́зово) is an administrative district (raion)
column2: one of the seventeen in North-Eastern Administrative Okrug of the federal city of Moscow
column3: Russia.  It is located 15 km north of Moscow city center
column4: on the south side of the Moscow Ring Road ('MKAD').   It borders with Moscow Oblast in the north
column7: and with Dmitrovsky District in the west.  The area is 6.6 square kilometres (2.5 sq mi).  As of the 2010 Census
column8: the total population of the district was 79

column1: The oldest known settlement on the territory of the present Lianozovo District is the village of Altufevo
column2: whose history can be traced back to the 16th century. At the village there was a church and a manor which repeatedly changed owners.
on whose territory the district is located
column3: arose at the beginning of the 20th century on the initiative of the industrialist S. G. Lianozov
column4: who bought the Altufiyevo estate in 1888 and arranged summer cottages on its lands. Dachas in Lianozovo were owned by members of famous Moscow families. After the 1917 Russian Revolution
column5: the settlement began to be populated by a public of proletarian and peasant origin. In 1960
column6: after the construction of the Moscow Ring Road
column7: the village became part of Moscow
column8: and by the end of the 1970s it was destroyed for the construction of multi-storey houses on its lands.

column2: it is incorporated as Lianozovo Municipal Okrug.
